title: Superintendent of police (India) - Wikipedia
snippet: The Superintendent of Police (SP) is a rank in Indian police forces held by an officer serving as the head of a rural police district.Officers of the same rank may also head specialised wings or units. In cities under commissionerate system, an SP may serve as the Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) under the Commissioner of Police.The SP reports directly to the district magistrate (collector ...

title: About: Superintendent of police (India) - DBpedia Association
snippet: Superintendent of police (SP) is a senior rank in the Indian Police Service (IPS). They wear a star and an Ashoka emblem on their epaulettes with 'IPS' below. The larger and more important districts in India are headed by a senior superintendent of police (SSP), while smaller district are headed by a superintendent of police (SP).
